results.content: Following along by rote, is not very informative. A beginner might be able to complete the project undertaken here and, with some imagination tweak it, but understanding what 90% of the terms mean or scripts really do is not something you learn as you go and windows users will also struggle to follow with the corresponding interface.
results.content_html: Following along by rote, is not very informative. A beginner might be able to complete the project undertaken here and, with some imagination tweak it, but understanding what 90% of the terms mean or scripts really do is not something you learn as you go and windows users will also struggle to follow with the corresponding interface.

results.content: This is a great course to make the transition to starting building applications with ReactJS! This course explains to you what is going on, under the hood when using JSX in React components etc I think to get as much from it is good to understand the basics of React, such as state, components, props
results.content_html: This is a great course to make the transition to starting building applications with ReactJS! This course explains to you what is going on, under the hood when using JSX in React components etc I think to get as much from it is good to understand the basics of React, such as state, components, props

results.content: very concise, good lecture-pace.  love the italic fonts of Reed's text editor: vs code.  hoping to learn vanilla JS and programming best practice.  thanks, Reed.
results.content_html: very concise, good lecture-pace. love the italic fonts of Reed's text editor: vs code. hoping to learn vanilla JS and programming best practice. thanks, Reed.

results.content: This really an awesome course to learn the modern javascript concepts that can be used in real world web apps.  Reed clearly explains everything about the js code he writes and also its usage in the web apps.
results.content_html: This really an awesome course to learn the modern javascript concepts that can be used in real world web apps. Reed clearly explains everything about the js code he writes and also its usage in the web apps.

results.content: Pretty good course, but the React translation felt rushed... And I don't think it was a good idea to present the React components without the explicit constructor method.
results.content_html: Pretty good course, but the React translation felt rushed... And I don't think it was a good idea to present the React components without the explicit constructor method.

results.content:
非常にわかりやすくて最良のコースでした。
特にReact側から入っている人は、一度jsでReactっぽい書き方をしてみるのはとてもいいと思います。
まだまだ個人的にはjsもわからないことはありますが時間配分、構成、まとめ方等最適でした。
もっとjsのコースを出してほしいですし、受講したいと思っています。
素晴らしいコースをありがとうございました。

results.content:
I liked that the course showed you how
to use ES6 to build a simple application
results.content_html:
I liked that the course showed you how
to use ES6 to build a simple application

results.content:
Great going so far.  I can't imagine how anybody taking this course will not end up at a level higher than they started.  Mr. Reed Barger not only explains at each step what he is doing but also, in cases where alternatives are there, show them and explain why we should choose one over the other--really an eyeopener for beginners like us how a coder should "think".  And even before we begin to build the app, he teaches us about Webpack and Babel, essential development tools for any JS developer.  Then, while building the actual app, we get to learn so many ES6 features:  classes, modules, promises, arrow functions, destructuring, the spread operator....  All these with top-class audio, video, and easily understandable English language delivery.  I highly recommend this course for any serious JavaScript learner.

Thank you, Mr. Reed Barger, for being such a fantastic teacher.  BEST!
results.content_html:
Great going so far. I can't imagine how anybody taking this course will not end up at a level higher than they started. Mr. Reed Barger not only explains at each step what he is doing but also, in cases where alternatives are there, show them and explain why we should choose one over the other--really an eyeopener for beginners like us how a coder should "think". And even before we begin to build the app, he teaches us about Webpack and Babel, essential development tools for any JS developer. Then, while building the actual app, we get to learn so many ES6 features: classes, modules, promises, arrow functions, destructuring, the spread operator.... All these with top-class audio, video, and easily understandable English language delivery. I highly recommend this course for any serious JavaScript learner.

Thank you, Mr. Reed Barger, for being such a fantastic teacher. BEST!
